sources.data_found: Members of Princeton Language and Intelligence (PLI) have exclusive access to 336 H100 SXM GPUs (42 nodes at 8 GPUs per node). Each H100 GPU provides 80 GB of GPU memory.
924 Nvidia GPUs across three major HPC clusters
A cluster of 300 Nvidia H100 GPUs will boost the University's robust computing infrastructure. The University's existing Della cluster consists of A100 GPU units.
This node features 64 CPU-cores, 512 GB RAM, and 2 A100 GPUs each with 80 GB of GPU memory. The four A100 GPUs with 40 GB of memory have been converted into eight GPUs with 20 GB of memory using MIG.

CS ionic cluster includes: 1 x Tyan Thunder server with 8x NVidia Tesla A100 80GB GPUs; 1 x Tyan Thunder servers with 10 x NVidia Quadro RTX 6000 GPUs; 4 x Tyan Thunder servers with 10 x NVidia RTX A5000 GPUs; 10 x Tyan Thunder servers with 10 x NVidia RTX A6000 GPUs each; 2 x Lenovo SR670 V2 servers with 8 x NVidia L40 GPUs each
Tiger is composed of 492 CPU nodes, 40 CPU nodes with 1 GPU, and 13 GPU nodes. Members of CIMES have access to forty L40S GPUs and eight H200 GPUs.
In 2023, the most popular Bachelors Degree concentrations at Princeton University were Computer Science (201 degrees awarded), Econometrics & Quantitative Economics (132 degrees)

student_data.notes: Based on DataUSA.io data showing 201 CS bachelor's degrees awarded in 2023. Assuming 4-year program with steady state enrollment, estimated undergraduate CS majors = 201 × 4 = 804. Graduate student numbers estimated based on typical master's program duration of 2 years (using published CS completion data and adjusting for program length). PhD count estimated based on Princeton's highly selective CS PhD program typical cohort size of ~25-30 students per year with 5-6 year completion time.

other_high_vram_gpus.notes: CS ionic cluster: 22 × Gigabyte servers with 8 × RTX 2080 Ti each + 11 × Tyan servers with 10 × RTX 2080 Ti each = 176 + 110 = 286 total
CS ionic cluster: 5 × Tyan Thunder servers with 10 × GTX 1080 Ti each = 50 total
CS ionic cluster: 1 × Tyan server with 10 × RTX 6000 = 10 total
CS ionic cluster: 4 × Tyan servers with 10 × A5000 each = 40 total
CS ionic cluster: 2 × Lenovo servers with 8 × L40 each = 16 total

gpu_resources.notes:
CALCULATION BREAKDOWN:

1) H100 SXM: PLI cluster has 42 nodes × 8 GPUs = 336 H100 SXM GPUs

2) H200: Tiger CIMES group has 8 H200 GPUs

3) A100 80GB: Adroit visualization node has 2 A100 80GB + CS ionic cluster has 8 A100 80GB = 10 total

4) A100 40GB: Total Princeton GPUs = 924 (stated) - 336 H100 - 8 H200 - 10 A100 80GB - other counted GPUs. The remaining A100 allocation based on statements about existing Della cluster consisting of A100 GPU units.

5) A6000: CS ionic cluster has 10 Tyan servers × 10 A6000 each = 100 total

6) L40S: Tiger CIMES has 40 L40S GPUs

Note: The 924 total GPU count across three major HPC clusters was used as a constraint, with the majority of uncategorized GPUs likely being A100 40GB based on documentation stating Della primarily consists of A100 units.

analysis_notes: Data collected December 15, 2025. GPU resources calculated from multiple sources including PLI H100 cluster specifications, CS department ionic cluster details, and overall Princeton Research Computing statistics. Student enrollment estimated from degree completion data.
